results.title: Cochin
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam makes a journey to the spicelands of south-west India, to the state of Kerala, a narrow strip of coastal plain.

results.title: Cocaine pain
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: This film is a documentary that takes a startling look at coke addiction. It examines how cocaine dominates the life of the users, damages their health, impairs their mental capabilities, alienates their friends and families, and consumes millions of their dollars.

results.title: Cocaine blues
results.creator_credit: John Langley, Malcolm Barbour and Barbour Langley Productions
results.brief_description: An estimated 22 million Americans have tried or are current users of cocaine. Written and produced for contemporary audiences of all ages, “Cocaine Blues” offers a graphic and honest perspective on cocaine’s history, effects and cultural impact in America. The film includes interviews with medical and legal experts, undercover figures and “average” Americans.

results.title: Cobra Verde = Slave coast [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog, Lucki Stipetic, Ghana Film Industry Corporation, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: Set in the early nineteenth century, Cobra Verde moves from Brazil to Dahomey in West Africa. Francisco Manoel de Silva, an historical figure at the centre of the novel, is amalgamated with that of the bandit Cobra Verde to serve Herzog’s private mythologising. But Verde is not as distinctly drawn as the obsessive characters played by Klaus Kinski in ‘Aguirre’ and ‘Fitzcarraldo’, the Herzog films with which Cobra Verde can be most directly compared. Loosely improvised and more of ‘a happening’, ‘Cobra Verde’ has some extraordinary scenes and magnificent images. The historical issues of slavery and colonialism are typically (for Herzog) subsumed in a mystico-spiritual game. Cast also includes King Ampaw, Jose Lewgoy and Salvatore Basile. In German with English subtitles. Based on the novel “The Viceroy of Ouidah” by Bruce Chatwin.

results.title: Coat hangers
results.brief_description: “No! Wire! Hangers … ever!” The now famous line from 1981 kitsch classic Mommie Dearest depicted coat hangers as the bane of Joan Crawford’s existence (among other things). And while that might be true in the context of this docudrama, they’ve also been a consistent presence on film sets since the dawn of the moving image. Practical and ingenious, coat hangers come in all shapes and sizes. This simple domestic object has been handmade or manufactured in wood, metal, plastic or wire. (The wire ones could also be bent into a map-of-Australia car aerial!) Coat hangers are an essential tool in the costume department.

constellations_other.name: Supplementing cinema
constellations_other.description: A celebration of b-grade cinema's never-ending quest for more, more, more.

results.title: Coastwatch
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Australia has the largest accessible coastline in the world. The first line of defence is the coastwatch. The Fremantle class a fast all weather vessel has been introduced as the new type of patrol boat that will provide security for the nation.

results.title: Coastal dunes
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Uses an experimental approach to explain the process of saltation (sand movement) in a typical English coastal dune system. Also explains the interrelationships that exist between vegetation and soil type - the changing nature of these two elements is shown by a transect taken across a typical dune system.
